channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump aims to turn out hardcore partisans and men while Harris goes after 10% still persuadable in final campaign sprint
item.description: One point on which both camps agree: The election will be decided by voters in just seven swing states.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani ordered to give 2 Georgia election workers he defamed his NYC apartment and a 1980 Mercedes once owned by Lauren Bacall
item.description: They won the $148 million judgment over Giuliani’s false ballot fraud claims against them related to the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Trump Accuses U.K. Labour Party of Election Meddling
item.description: A complaint from the Trump campaign says that actions by members of Britain’s Labour Party were “blatant foreign interference.” Mr. Trump has previous...

item.title: Why Gender May Be the Defining Issue of the Election
item.description: The issue is rarely directly addressed by either Vice President Kamala Harris or Donald Trump. But the 2024 contest is, in ways overt and subtle, a re...

item.title: American Airlines Fined $50 Million for Treatment of Disabled Travelers Using Wheelchairs
item.description: The Transportation Department issued the fine after an investigation revealed “cases of unsafe physical assistance that at times resulted in injuries ...

item.title: Displaced Gazans Brace for Another Harsh Winter
item.description: After a year of war, at least one million people are facing months in the cold. Some said tents, blankets and warm clothes now qualified as luxuries.

item.title: 4 Can’t-Miss Towns in an Often Overlooked Corner of Japan
item.description: Kyushu, often passed over by international visitors, is rich in crafts, history and culture. Here are four destinations to consider.

item.title: Character.ai Faces Lawsuit After Teen’s Suicide
item.description: The mother of a 14-year-old Florida boy says he became obsessed with a chatbot on Character.AI before his death.

item.title: Blinken Renews Push for Middle East Truce, and U.S. Abortions Increase
item.description: Plus, a radical approach to flooding in England.

item.title: Keir Starmer shrugs off Trump’s accusation that the Labour Party is meddling in U.S. elections—but insists he wants to remain friends
item.description: “The interference is occurring in plain sight,” the letter from the Trump campaign’s legal team says.

item.title: The defunct AmazonSmile charitable program worked. I know because I co-founded Tripadvisor using the same principles
item.description: Tripadvisor's success is a testament to human generosity and the power of‬ collective impact.

item.title: White Blobs Wash Up on Canada’s Beaches, Stumping Everyone
item.description: Over a month after the substance began appearing on the southern shores of Newfoundland, a federal agency is still investigating.

item.title: Who Is Hashem Safieddine, a Hezbollah Official Israel Says It Killed?
item.description: A cousin of Hassan Nasrallah, the Hezbollah leader assassinated earlier by Israel, Safieddine had been seen as a possible successor.

item.title: GM’s Cruise is driving toward profit
item.description: It's also resumed "limited" driverless testing in Houston.

item.title: Brazilian Artist Sends a Message to the Country’s Biggest Soy Exporter
item.description: Using natural materials from environmental disasters around the country, a Brazilian activist sends a message to a U.S. farming giant.
